description: Five short reflective blog posts (200-300 words each) on lab experiences, open science practices, and R coding progress. Includes peer feedback comments. Submitted in Weeks 1,3,5,7,9.
Individual RMarkdown report demonstrating data wrangling/visualization skills using a provided dataset. Requires code implementation and explanatory comments. 48-hour completion window in Week 4.

10-minute team presentation in Week 8 labs covering verification project outcomes, challenges faced, reproducibility insights, and teamwork reflections. Includes peer contribution evaluations (10% group work component).

Individual report in two parts: Part A verifies reproduced analyses with R code/commentary (Week 9), Part B explores additional research questions (study week). Includes open science recommendations. Combines technical implementation and critical evaluation.
